content.text: 1 (a) Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 30 and 75 .
(b) Share \(\$ 608\) in the ratio \(4:5:7\).
Give your answer in standard form.
(d) Write \(0.27\) as a fraction.
(e) A stone has volume \(45 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\) and mass 126 g . Find the density of the stone, giving the units of your answer.
[Density \(=\) mass \(\div\) volume]
The points \(P, Q, R\) and \(S\) lie on a circle with diameter \(P R\).
Work out the size of angle \(P S Q\), giving a geometrical reason for each step of your working.
The points \(A, B\) and \(T\) lie on a circle and \(C T S\) is a tangent to the circle at \(T\).
\(A B C\) is a straight line and \(A B=B T\).
Angle \(A T S=98^{\circ}\).
Work out the size of angle \(A C T\).
Angle \(A C T=\)
(a) Calculate the length of line \(l\).
(b) Find the equation of the perpendicular bisector of line \(l\) in the form \(y=m x+c\).
(c) A point \(H\) lies on the \(y\)-axis such that the distance \(G H=13\) units.
Find the coordinates of the two possible positions of \(H\).
( and )
3 A line, \(l\), joins point \(F(3,2)\) and point \(G(-5,4)\).
(a) Find \(C B\).
(b) (i) Find angle \(A D B\).
Angle \(A D B=\) [1]
(ii) Find \(A B\).
(c) Calculate the area of the trapezium.
\(A B C D\) is a trapezium with \(D C\) parallel to \(A B\).
\(D C=6.4 \mathrm{~cm}, D B=10.9 \mathrm{~cm},\) angle \(C D B=38^{\circ}\) and angle \(D A B=45^{\circ}\).
5 (a) Draw the lines of symmetry of the rectangle.
(i) Describe fully the single transformation that maps
6 (a) At a festival, 380 people out of 500 people questioned say that they are camping. There are 55300 people at the festival.
Calculate an estimate of the total number of people camping at the festival.
(b) 12 friends travel to the festival. 5 travel by car, 4 travel by bus and 3 travel by train. Two people are chosen at random from the 12 friends.
Calculate the probability that they travel by different types of transport.
(c) Arno buys a student ticket for \(\$ 43.68\). This is a saving of \(16 \%\) on the full price of a ticket.
Calculate the full price of a ticket.
(i) At the end of the football match, the people leave at a rate of 400 people per minute, correct to the nearest 50 people.
Calculate the lower bound for the number of minutes it takes for all the people to leave.
(ii) At a cricket match there are 27 500 people, correct to the nearest 100.
Calculate the upper bound for the difference between the number of people at the football match and at the cricket match.
(d) At a football match, there are 29 800 people, correct to the nearest 100.
(a) Calculate an estimate of the mean mass.
(b) Draw a histogram to show the information in the table.
(c) (i) Use the frequency table to complete this cumulative frequency table.
(ii) Calculate the percentage of children with a mass greater than 10 kg .
7 Information about the mass, \(m \mathrm{~kg}\), of each of 150 children is recorded in the frequency table.
8 (a) Solve.
(b) Make \(m\) the subject of the formula.
(c) Solve.
(d) Solve the simultaneous equations. You must show all your working.
(e) Expand and simplify.
In triangle \(P Q R, M\) lies on \(Q R\) and \(S\) lies on \(P R\).
Explain, giving reasons, why triangle \(P M R\) is similar to triangle \(M S R\).
(i) Find the value of \(x\).
(ii) The area of triangle \(P Q R\) is \(25 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
Calculate the area of triangle \(A B C\).
Triangle \(A B C\) is similar to triangle \(P Q R\).
10 (a) Find all the positive integers which satisfy the inequality.
(i) Find these three inequalities.
(ii) Write down the largest value of \(3 x+y\) in the region \(R\) for integers \(x\) and \(y\).
The region marked \(R\) is defined by three inequalities.
(i) Show that the radius of the cylinder is 4.46 cm , correct to 3 significant figures.
(ii) Calculate the volume of the cylinder.
(iii) \(N\) is a point on the base of the cylinder, such that \(B N\) is a diameter.
Calculate the angle between \(A N\) and the base of the cylinder.
A rectangular sheet of paper \(A B C D\) is made into an open cylinder with the edge \(A B\) meeting the
\(A D=28 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(A B=20 \mathrm{~cm}\).
(b) The volume of a solid cone is \(310 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).
The height of the cone is twice the radius of its base.
Calculate the slant height of the cone.
[The volume, \(V\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(V=\frac{1}{3} \pi r^{2} h\).]
(a) Show that \(k=1.5\).
(b) Find the coordinates of the two stationary points of \(y=x^{3}-1.5 x^{2}+1\). You must show all your working.
(c) Sketch the curve \(y=x^{3}-1.5 x^{2}+1\).

When \(x=2\), the gradient of the curve is 6 .
